questions.question: What is not in the EXPOSITION of a story?

choices.answer: introduction of the characters
presentation of the setting
back ground information to the story
the conflict

questions.question: What is the RISING ACTION part of the story?

choices.answer: The events in the confict or problem a character faces
The challenges a character faces leading up to the climax
1 and 2 are correct
The highest most intense part of the conflict
A problem between characters.
A struggle a character has within him or herself.
A struggle between the character and nature.
Answers 1 to 3 are correct.

questions.question: What is the FALLING ACTION in a story?

choices.answer: The events that lead up to the climax.
The introduction to the conflict.
The events or what happens after the climax.
The conclusion to the story.

questions.question: The CLIMAX is the highest point of the conflict or turning point in the conflict.

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: The RESOLUTION of the story is...

choices.answer: The high poin of the conflict.
How the story ends and the conflict resolves successfully or not.
The lesson or moral of the story
The time or place of the story

questions.question: What is the THEME of the story.

choices.answer: The message or lesson of the story.
The problem or challenge the characters face
The setting
The topic or subject matter of the story.

questions.question: What is the PLOT of a story?

choices.answer: The introduction and conclusion of a story.
The main character and other characters in a story.
How the characters solve their problmes.
All the events or things that happen in a story.
